epoq
If you have built your castle already , you will start the war on the 1st of February.

Just to confirm that after our discussion on the next clan war which took place in June, this Clan War will last for ONE MONTH. This clan war will finish on the 1st of March.

I know you all want new content, and as you've seen, there are occasionally teething problems with the transfer of content from two communities that are as different as the EN and FR servers. As this is the first time we have tried these rules on this server, we are going to be looking for plenty of feedback on the war - as ever, please keep it constructive.

The new system has many improvements over the old clan wars, and the levels serve to protect smaller clans, at least a little!

If the war goes well, we'll have another one soon...

All the best,
Epoq

On january 20, 2011
epoq
Clan War Questions Answered (in no particular order!)

-XP rewards for defenders will remain the same.

-The Heroic Actions are awarded randomly.

-Heroic Actions trigger automatically.

-Spells trigger either automatically (eg. Black Beauty) or at the start of the next combat (eg. Absolute Terror)

-Magic Fog blocks attacks for 30 seconds after EACH ATTACK.

-Stocks of Mana start from zero and will last until the end of the Clan War.

-Permanent Spells will last for the duration of the current Clan War.

-Nobody will be able to change clan during the last 10 days of the war.

-Defence is limited to 1.3 times the power of the attacking group, so if the attacking group is limited to 90, the defending group is limited to 117.

I hope this has answered all your questions...

Epoq

On january 20, 2011
Veren
Questions:
1. Where /how is the "minimum number of defenders" defined ?

minimum defender is 1, even if he is way stronger than attackers, additional defenders are added according to the strengh of the attacking group (see next question)


2. Are there now limits on the number of defenders based on the number of attackers ?
you point it your self in question 4
it's not the number of defenders that is limited, but the defenses power (sum of levels)
if attacker attack with 3 lvl 30 (so power 90)
then defense is limited to 117
and game chose defenders so that they are the closest possible to 117 but bellow
lets say you have 3 lvl3 lvl 40 and 2 lvl 30 as ddefenders, the game sent the 2 lvl 40 (the 3rd bring the total to 120, so too high) and add a lvl 30
so you will have 2 lvl 40 + 1 lvl 30 so 3 dinoz with a total of 110

if you have only lvl 30 dinoz asdefenders, the game pick 4 ofthem with a total of 120


3. If a clan gets both spells ('celestial troops' and 'defensive reinforcements'), are they combined ?
yes, also celestial troops is an instant spell, so it work only for 1 assault, after this you have to cast it again if you want to use it next fight
defensive reinforcement is "permanent", so it work as long as your castel is build (i can't confirm if the spell is still on if you rebuild the castel after a defeat)

4. If either or both of these spells are used, do the 'power' limits still apply where defence is limited to 1.3 times the power of the attacking group ?
no, the power limit is used to select the "good" number of defenders and only then the game pick additionnal defenders (probably some of the lowest level availlable, also i'm not sure of this and it need some confirmation)

Definitions are helpful byt some terms may be used interchangeably so context is important. From what I have read so far, here is how terms seem to be used:

* clan war(s) = mean the entire month of CW5 as inA Clan War generally lasts a few months. The 5th Clan war will last 1 month only.
* a war = declare war against another clanOnce a war has been declared, it will last for 100 hours. A War can be cancelled, but your Clan will only win if you are able to destroy your opponents' Castle.
* the term battle seems to be interchangeable with the terms fight and attack = action by an individual player ... see alsoWhen your castle is attacked, but not destroyed, your defenders' morale increases.andYour Dinoz will fly until the end of the battle, but they will still take one point of damage every turn.andNormal battle duration.andIf all defenders die during a fight or there are no defenders left, the castle will be damaged.
* the term attack is also used interchangeably with 'declare war' as in A Clan can't keep attacking the same opponent.Once he has won a victory for each 100 reputation points of the opponent Clan, he won't be able to attack it anymoreandIf you attack and defeat a clan with 0 Reputation Points, you will win 0 points.

On february 11, 2011
Husaurus
I am coming to the conclusion that this 1000 point barrier (or any other barrier) is not doing anything to improve the war. I think it would be better to have a free for all, and scale down the rep point gains for beating clans with much lower scores.

Current Score Method = Sum of All Reputations Defeated x Reputation

I suggest no barriers and something more like:

Score = Sum of All[Reputation Defeated x (1 + Score Defender/Score Attacker)/2] x Reputation

With the Score Defender and Score Attacker being calculated using the Current Score Method. The point would be to make attacking a larger clan more profitable than a small clan, without restricting the targets. In fact, there might even be a tipping point in there where a win against a really small clan actually lowers the Score... but it is just a rough formula anyway.

Lets look at this from a different perspective.

I joined a clan only weeks before the COTC. I was never in a clan war, so looked forward to bth COTC and the 5th clan war (at the time, we had no idead which was next).

COTC... it allowed for the clan, no matter what your time zone to plan something at a specific time and attempt to fight together as a clan. I enjoyed it very much and felt spending money was worth my time.

5th Clan War... My 1st clan war and after enjoying COTC and spending money to level up dinos and prepare with battle items, I was excited to play. I had no OLD SYSTEM to compare it to, so fr me it was a First Impression sort of speak of what Clan Wars are like.

1st week was great, we were able to attack a few clans, when some lose some, we were even 2nd and 3rd place for a little while. then we get over 1.000 and have to wait to attack another clan, while getting attacked continuously. then wait even more for clans to get over 1.000 and rush to get damage in before a stronger clan destroyed that castle or our own. then wait even more only to log on at 00:02 and find 5 clans attacking that 1 clan that just made it over 1.000 and oly have time to get 3-4 hits in, but not get 75 damage nor the final hit. waiting again for 2 days, refreshing and searching for the 1-3 targets to build a castle to attack.

Long story short... it ended up being boring as hell after the 1st week. thr result was attacking a clan that was obviously too hard to take down, just to "see what my dinos can do" and learn from it. Then sitting at computer defending castle against several clans, just to have something to do during the war. End result... there is no way without spending crazy amounts of money for lower level clans to ever compete with the top 10. as lower level clans spend money and try to level up and become strong even to defeat stronger clans... the stronger clans are also continuing to spend money and are winning all the Napos that give an advantage.

I dont think at all that stronger clan should be handy capped nor penalized for the money and time they put into the game. what I do think is that there needs to be a system that allows lower level clans to actually have more fights, even if only against clans their level. would be nice to not be stuck over 1.000 but not have a rep of 200 yet. The current system is actually handy capping the lower level clans between 11-30. 11-20 can only fight each other once, but cant attack any clans under 1.000, its very limited.

Well, thats a story, a long post and i'll cut it off at this point. I only write this because i feel it would be nice for MT to get an idea of the experience, because it appears they only program and makes plans as to how much money can be brought. being a company, money is priority, but will money continue to flow in if no one enjoys what they are spending their money on? I think not.

Good Luck to All Clans the rest of this war, lets hope there are a few tweaks that will make it more FUN, so that we are ALL willing to spend money for better, faster updates

On february 23, 2011
Piemaster
I too don't like the way this war is panning out much, but I also haven't liked any of the suggestions I have heard so far to improve it really, as they either won't work or will create a host of problems of their own. So I decided to think about it and work out a format that might actually work. Here is what I have come up with:

What if the war was divided into two halves. The first half (two weeks in this war for example) would be a free-for-all where everybody could attack everybody else and get maximum of one net-win (no more of this reputation over 200 nonsense). Once the first half is over, the clans are divided into 4 divisions depending on their ranking. Division 1 - 1-15, division 2 - 16-30, division 3 - 31-50, division 4 - 51+. Then the points are reset and the second period starts. In this period you would only be allowed to attack clans in your division and once again can only get 1 net win against each clan (which has been reset from the first period).

To avoid the CotC problems of adverse selection, your position at the end of the war would be determined first by division. So last place in division 1 would be awarded 15th, top of division 2 would be awarded 16th and so on. Prizes would be similar to now, but maybe with more steps in the prize levels to make sure as many clans as possible have something to play for in the second half. Everyone in division 1 would get at least 1 napo with further prizes depending on position. Everyone in division 2 would get an epic and most would get some notes/coins/irmas and the top 5 would also get a napo. Everyone in division 3 would get some kind of nominl prize, but better prizes for those who finish higher. In division 4 only the top few clans would receive any kind of prize.

Comments/thoughts/suggestions?

Husaurus
Here's some ideas.
1) Make "Scales" a curse, so "Breath of Life" negates it.
2) List both wins and losses in the Clan stats.
3) Get rid of the Reputation system. Use Wins followed by Win rankings of the those you've beaten... more like the CoTC.
4) Multiple Wars could be based on Vendetta... clearly if there is no rep... but based on number of revenge wars. Something like: A attacks B. B revenge attacks A, then two Wins are allowed between A and B.
5) Minimum Vendetta level is two less than a clan's maximum Vendetta win. So if A and B keep fighting it out and A gets 4 wins on B, then everyone is allowed two wins on A.
6) Hiding behind broken castle walls results in a scoring loss at the end of the second day... and the price of repair should go up.
7) Sort the Declare War listing with the declarable wars at the top.
8.) After the walls go down, have a secondary battle within the walls, like the CoTC field or something... something which takes place at a random time, announced in advance... so cheap kills are not the end all of the Wars.
9) Keep the Wars a free for all... barriers do not improve things.
10) For the love of Epoq, make Wars more fun and less stressful.

Or something like that.

On february 25, 2011
[939518]
In the last few days Druid and me was thinking a lot how to make the war system better.
We came up with the following:

- clans should be register before the start, joining to clans would be prohibited till the duration of the war and each clan should contain minimum 10 members to be able to join the war(no ghost clans)

- no restrictions to the level of attackers and no point system, so every clan is a legal target for everybody

- only 1 clan can declare war against a clan, so no multi wins, no helping to take defence

- you can declare war against each clan only once, so you have 1 chance to destroy his castle, but if you did, then your victory and their defeat will remain till the end, even if they will destroy your castle(this would give a reason to attack a stronger clan, because even if they will come back you still have a victory over them, and would give more reason to defend)

- the rep loss at midnight for not rebuilding the castle should be changed to 5 percent of the current rep

- upgrades should have a shorter build time, spells and moral should be like now

- the 10 minutes waiting after an attack should be increased to 1 hour(multiplied by upgrades) thisway the power of the clan would be given by many members and not just 1 or 2

I think this would solve all current problems, but maybe it would create some others, so please think on it and if you find a flaw in the system please let me know.
On february 25, 2011
[884682]
"you can declare war against each clan only once"
to be more precise:

- if you declare a war against any other clan, that will count for the only declaration you have
- till the counter runs out you will have the opportunity to destroy your target's castle.
- if you succeed, then victory is claimed. if you win, or if time runs out or the attack will be canceled: there wont be any more opportunity to declare war against that clan!

if you win against anybody, then they can not take the victory back! this will lead at the end to 1-0, 0-0, 0-1, or 1-1 situations. Clearly the strongest clan would have lots of 1-0 and a few 1-1 results (and there would be reason for clans to have a try against stronger ones!)

in the current system there is no way that anybody would try to attack against a stronger clan, because they will take that back for sure. that is the main reason why now the war stuck at a certain point. The other flaw which should be corrected is the interfering clans situation. the system above handles that too..

if you would let multiple wars at the same time, then the strongest clan could take out the defense for any other clan letting other (weaker) clans to win with his help (every time they have war, they would take 1-3 other clans with them), so that would be easy to corrupt the system..

On march 4, 2011
Martock
My thoughts on this last war....great improvements!

1. Rewards for top 50...great idea to help reward clans that won't get a napo and provide battles for more top of X positions. I liked seeing the battles for 35 and 50.

2. Mana... Some say too expensive, others say too powerful. If people complain on both sides then it sounds just about right. The 1 use spells really seperate who has ingredients and who doesn't. High level gatherers are useful and we can all be better prepared next war cycle to have them. This creates greater contributions from players who can't be as active as others to attack or defend but can use irmas to get more ingredients. Great idea!

3. 1 month war... just right amount of time. Many clans sat around below the 1k line twiddling their thumbs for the first 1-2 weeks anyway and with only about 50 clans getting above 1k at any point of time it seems perfectly fine.

4. 1k barrier... A good thing about it was it stopped clans building walls at the end of war from giving points to higher ranked clans. The bad thing is we have too few clans on this server going above the 1k bar to allow for enough warring. It also forces clans to have to sit and wait at the 1k line until all the bigger clans have finally taken their win. The positive of that though is that big clans were better off getting wins on medium clans sooner rather than later since there weren't any other targets for them to hit anyway. I don't know anyone who liked having to actively watch for clans going over 1k though so overall a big minus.

Keep up the good work MT. Things are getting better.
